str2: Large, great, in the widest sense.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of martus; something evidential, i.e. evidence given or, the Decalogue.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A rising again, resurrection. From anistemi; a standing up again, i.e. a resurrection from death (its author), or a recovery.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
